snippet: The company, struggling to keep pace in consumer electronics, said it planned to sell its Vaio PC unit to an investment fund and cut 5,000 jobs.
abstract: Sony, predicting loss of 110 billion yen, or about $1.1 billion, in current fiscal year, will sell its unprofitable personal computer unit and turn its troubled television manufacturing business into a separate, wholly owned subsidiary; company will also cut 5,000 jobs; reports quarterly net income of 27 billion yen, or $267 million, following loss of 10.8 billion yen one year earlier; revenue rose to 2.41 trillion yen from 1.95 trillion, though main factor was weaker yen.

byline.contributor: William Alden contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The company, struggling to keep pace in consumer electronics, said it planned to sell its Vaio PC unit to an investment fund and cut 5,000 jobs.

headline.main: After Losses, Yet Another Overhaul for Sony
